page.text: 4137 N. Broad Street
Philadelphia, PA 19140
nicole.palin1@gmail.com
Master of Health Education graduate student with a focus in research both qualitative and quantitative.
Strong communication, organizational, and interpersonal skills. Very detail oriented and able to adapt to
different professional atmospheres. Highly proficient in both written and computer-based data collection,
communication, documentation, and presentation to those both directly and indirectly involved in
community health education and social sciences. Understanding of the importance of time management
and able to multitask efficiently.
December 2015

text.i: Bachelors of Science in Public Health/Health Service Administration

TEMPLE UNIVERSITY CENTER FOR ASIAN HEALTH May 2015 – September 2015
Managed the Asian Restaurant - Low Sodium African American Clergy Training
Developed marketing promotions for the Asian Restaurant - Low Sodium Chinese Take-Out Initiative
Performed research on various health topics and writing literature reviews
Assisted with writing articles for the Improving Diets with an Ecological Approach for Lifestyle in
Asian Americans (IDEAL) program
Collected and performed data analysis from “taste tastings” throughout various neighborhoods in
Philadelphia for the Low Sodium Chinese Take-Out Restaurant Initiative

CHILDRENS SURGICAL ASSOCIATES | PHILADELPHIA, PA March 2005 - September 2006

Very detail oriented and able to adapt to different professional atmospheres. Highly proficient in both written and computer-based data collection, communication, documentation, and presentation to those both directly and indirectly involved in community health education and social sciences. Understanding of the importance of time management and able to multitask efficiently.
